description: From Powhatan pichamins, pushemins, pasimenan (“dried fruit”), from the same Proto-Algonquian root *-imin (“fruit, berry”) as Unami ximin.

entries.meaning: A type of fruit, of orange colour, very sweet, quite astringent when immature.
examples: Synonyms: date plum, kaki, Sharon fruit

entries.meaning: The tree this fruit grows on, generally one of two species of ebony: Diospyros kaki (Asian) or Diospyros virginiana (North American).
